abstract: United Nations human rights chief Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein says security improvements in Central Africa Republic, recovering from ethnic and sectarian violence that took place in 2013, are too gradual and says peacekeeping effort needs to be more aggressive.
lead_paragraph: Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein, the United Nations human rights chief, said improvements in the country, riven by ethnic and sexual violence in 2013, were “too gradual.”

headline.main: U.N. Official Urges Stronger Action by Peacekeepers in Central African Republic
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Africa; Central African Republic: More Peacekeepers Needed, Official Says

snippet: Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein, the United Nations human rights chief, said improvements in the country, riven by ethnic and sexual violence in 2013, were “too gradual.”
